name: Confédération Européenne des Entrepreneurs de Travaux Techniques Agricoles, Ruraux et Forestiers/ European Organisation of Agricultural, Rural and Forestry Contractors / Europäischer Zentralverband der Lohnunternehmer
goal:
CEETTAR's objectives are to:

Represent the national federations and defend their professional interests in relation to the EU together with all the public or private bodies that are active at European level and beyond.

Propose to the European Commission new ideas in the area of agriculture policy, employment policy, research and innovation, health and safety, environment and climate change.

Help organisations in the new Member States to fulfil their national objectives as rapidly as possible and under the best conditions through the know-how transfer developed by the Common Agriculture Policy.

Land-based contractors are professional businesses who hire out their services to farmers, land-owners, local authorities and other businesses. They mainly conduct outside work, whether in agriculture or the forestry industries, which requires the use of modern heavy vehicles. Outside these sectors, land-based contractors also assist with municipal works, maintenance of the countryside, paths and water surfaces, protection of the natural environment, composting, land reclamation and even dredging operations.

Land-based contractors bring new ideas for more efficient and sustainable services to agriculture, local communities and forest. They play also a major role in providing jobs in rural areas.
interests: Agriculture and Rural Development, Budget, Business and Industry, Climate Action, Competition, Digital economy and society, Economy, finance and the euro, Employment and Social Affairs, Energy, Environment, Food Safety, Regional Policy, Research and innovation, Single market, Taxation, Transport
